children.subject: Yes, if there's space.

Other students can wait list beginning 5/9 when the class opens for enrollment past just EECS/CS Seniors. The difference is that you will remain on the wait list until the adjustment period begins IF there are any seats available.
When the adjustment period begins, can other students enroll or waitlist?
As a follow-up, does this mean "senior" where CalCentral lists "Level", or by terms in attendance?

Under Enrollment Requirements on Calcentral it says: "Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences (EECS), EECS/Nuclear Engineering, EECS/Materials Science and Engineering, or Computer Science Majors with 7 or more Terms in Attendance"
By "seniors" do you mean juniors who will be seniors in Fall 2019? Or does it only include seniors who will be starting their fifth year of study in Fall 2019?

Obviously if the class had been assigned a larger classroom, we could have taken more students but unfortunately that's not what happened. To date the teaching philosophy of faculty has been to NOT webcast the class. I cannot say what will happen in the future.

Is this decision made because of this class only get to be assigned this room which has a small capacity? In other (future) semesters, if this class get a larger room, can it accommodate more students and be webcasted? Thanks!
You should be able to see that information by looking on classes.berkeley.edu.
what time is the lecture going to be?
No

No, this is the first/only time we have done this and it's to offset the fact that the class opened WELL past all senior enrollment appointments. It's not a perfect solution but the best we could do to help out seniors who need to take this class.

The class will open to ALL students at 9:00am on Thursday 5/9/2019. At that time anyone can attempt to enroll and the regular reserve requirements will be in effect meaning non EECS/CS majors will be wait listed until the adjustment period begins. At that time, the wait list will automatically enroll people from the wait list in sequential order IF there are any seats open.
Just to clarify, will enrollment open to all students on 5/9 or 5/19?
5/9 - we are giving EECS/CS major seniors TWO DAYS advantage to enroll. Enrollment for everyone else will open on THURSDAY of this week.
Is it a convention that CS 189 only open to seniors?
Doesn't apply to you. CS 189 is an advanced CS upper-div so it is supposed to be taken after declaration.
How about undeclared senior transfer student?
If you have concerns about this, please email cs-enrollments@berkeley.edu.

"We're doing this to minimize the impact to seniors missing any advantage their enrollment appointment time would have given them. During this time, only our majors who are seniors will be able to enroll or wait list in the class. The class will remain closed to all others."

What about Regents Students who also have an advantage in enrollment appointment time? Shouldn't it be open to them as well, since they enroll before seniors, out of fairness to individuals with priority enrollment?
The post clearly mentions ds102 as an alternative for DS "seniors".
I don't really agree with the "DS majors can just enroll in stat102 now" policy because stat102 is like 70 people. Thats not really sufficient for all of Data Science
Both EECS and CS.

It actually means seniors (7+ semesters in F19) who are declared in the following majors:

EECS

EECS/NE

EECS/MSE

CS
The "senior" means no matter EECS or CS or just CS?
+1. CS170 is in Pimentel and is currently being webcasted.
189 is usually never webcasted in fall semester. This has continued for several years and last semester they did not even offer piazza Q&A
Is there a reason why 189 will not be webcast even though Pimentel has webcast capabilities?
Again - if you have concerns about this please email cs-enrollments@berkeley.edu and include your SID.

Regent's Scholars should be able to enroll tomorrow 5/7 too, due to priority enrollment, even if they are not CS majors. The reason I chose to come to Berkeley was for this priority enrollment, and I would like to take this class next semester.
If you're an undergrad student you need instructor consent to enroll into any grad level class. The enrollment system considers that a 'career' restriction.
Would I have to contact the instructor of the course directly?
Yes, only the instructor can give you instructor consent to enroll into a class.
Can Applied Mathematics students with a focus in Data Science take CS 289A? It says I need permission to take the class and I am assuming it is because I am not a CS/EECS major
Yes, all of the sections are on Friday by design. (I'm not sure why, I simply checked that this was an intentional choice and was told 'yes'.)
Where can we see when the sections are?
search for the class on classes.berkeley.edu

All of the 189 sections on CalCentral are unable to be enrolled in because we're expected to enroll in the 999 section at the bottom of the list. However, are these other listed sections expected to be the sections for next semester? Only asking so I can get a sense of my schedule for next semester, and all of the sections are on Friday

Is the usual reserve requirement reserving all of the remaining open seats for EECS, EECS/NE, EECS/MSE, and CS majors as listed on the course catalog? Will it stay like this until after everybody's phase 2? I'm a junior who is declared CS, but I have 3 other classes that I have to phase 1, and I would really like to take this class in the fall.
Yes, we have gone to the usual reserve requirements for this class now. https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#upper
I have now removed the restriction for EECS/Seniors only & the regular reserve seating should now be in place.

You're welcome to wait list now. The only 'issue' is that the wait list won't process you into any open seats until the adjustment period begins on 8/19/19. The earlier you place yourself on the wait list, the better your chances of getting into the class assuming seats open. Once the adjustment period begins, the wait list enrolls students strictly on wait list order - it doesn't matter what your major is.

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#upper
Hello, I'm still confused about when I will be allowed to even join the waitlist for this class. I am not declared EECS, EECS/NE, EECS/MSE or CS, but Fall 2019 will be my last semester.

Sorry, no. Teaching staff has specifically said they will not webcast. Perhaps contacting the DSP office for assistance might be helpful? (As staff member, I'm not familiar with all the services they offer.)
Is 189 still not being webcasted? As a DSP student it makes the course a lot easier to manage, so I am hoping it will be. Thank you!

history.content:
CS 189/289A is being taught in Pimentel in F19 which holds significantly fewer students than Wheeler and the class WILL NOT BE WEBCAST which means that enrollment will NOT expand past the levels indicated below.
The classes WILL use 999 sections for enrollment, they will NOT allow time conflicts. 
Total seats = 465 for EECS, EECS/NE, EECS/MSE or CS
NOTE: This class will open to declared EECS, EECS/NE, EECS/MSE or CS SENIORS ONLY at 9am on 5/7/19. 
We're doing this to minimize the impact to seniors missing any advantage their enrollment appointment time would have given them. During this time, only our majors who are seniors will be able to enroll or wait list in the class. The class will remain closed to all others. 
The class will open for enrollment with the usual reserve requirement at 9am on 5/19 and will remain in effect until the adjustment period begins on 8/19.
Note for Data Science Majors: In past semesters, a number of seats have been dedicated for DS seniors. In F19, Data Science majors are being encouraged to enroll into STAT C102 instead of CS 189. If you have questions or concerns about this matter, please contact Laura Imai.
history.subject: F19: CS 189 opening for EECS and CS seniors ONLY beginning at 9:00am on 5/7/19 - READ THIS NOTE!
